description.narrative: The World Banks (WB) Water Services and Institutional Support (WASIS) project in Mozambique aims to support the Mozambique National Directorate of Water to increase access to water in four large cities in the Northern Provinces and establish a new institutional and regulatory framework for water supply systems in smaller towns and cities. Funding from AusAID will focus on delivery of new institutional arrangements in two towns: Illha de Mozambique and Mocimboa da Praia. The expected result is delivery of treated water supply to an estimated 84,000 people. Funding will support: a) physical investments- to improve and expand existing water supply systems in each town; b) institutional investments- to support the establishment of viable water service providers able to operate, manage and maintain the expanded and improved water systems; and c) provision of management training and the development of strategic sanitation plans for the two towns. The total value of this initiative is $17.25
